required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of LY900014 Versus Insulin Lispro (Humalog) on High Blood Sugar in Participants With Type 1 Diabetes Who Use Insulin Pumps
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of LY900014 on Recovery From Hyperglycemia Compared to Humalog in Subjects With Type 1 Diabetes Mellitus (T1DM) on Continuous Subcutaneous Insulin Infusion

brief_summary.textblock: The main purpose of this study is to compare LY900014 to insulin lispro (Humalog) in participants with type 1 diabetes who are using an insulin pump and have high blood sugar after eating. For each participant, the study will last about two to nine weeks.

primary_outcome.measure: Time to Recovery from Hyperglycemia Following Administration of LY900014 and Insulin Lispro (Humalog)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1: Baseline up to 5 hours after missed meal bolus
primary_outcome.description: Time to recovery from hyperglycemia following administration of LY900014 and insulin lispro (Humalog)

primary_outcome.measure: Time to Recovery from Hyperglycemia Following Administration of LY900014 and Insulin Lispro (Humalog)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 2: Baseline up to 5 hours after pump suspension
primary_outcome.description: Time to recovery from hyperglycemia following administration of LY900014 and insulin lispro (Humalog)

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacodynamics (PD): Maximum Observed Plasma Glucose (PGmax) Following Administration of LY900014 and Insulin Lispro (Humalog) by Day
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1: Baseline up to 5 hours after missed meal bolus and Day 2: Baseline up to 5 hours after pump suspension
secondary_outcome.description: PD: PGmax following administration of LY900014 and insulin lispro (Humalog) by day

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetics (PK): Time to Maximum Observed Insulin Lispro Concentration (Tmax) Following Administration of LY900014 and Insulin Lispro (Humalog) by Day
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1: Baseline up to 5 hours after missed meal bolus and Day 2: Baseline up to 5 hours after pump suspension
secondary_outcome.description: PK: Tmax following administration of LY900014 and insulin lispro (Humalog) by day

arm_group.description: LY900014 administered by continuous subcutaneous insulin infusion (CSII) in one of two study periods.
Insulin lispro (Humalog) administered by CSII in one of two study periods.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male or female participants with type 1 diabetes
- Body mass index (BMI) between 18.5 and 30.0 kilograms per square meter, inclusive
- Hemoglobin A1c (HbA1c) less than or equal to 8.5 percent (%)
- Using CSII and stable insulin regimen for at least 3 months prior to inclusion into the trial
Exclusion Criteria:
- Known or suspected hypersensitivity to investigational medical product(s) or related products
- Receipt of any medicinal product in clinical development within 30 days or at least 5 half-lives of the related substances and their metabolites (whichever is longer) before randomization in this trial
- Known slowing of gastric emptying and or gastrointestinal surgery that, in the opinion of the investigator, might change gastrointestinal motility and food absorption
- Proliferative retinopathy or maculopathy as judged by the Investigator based on a recent (less than 1.5 years) ophthalmologic examination
- Widespread subcutaneous lipodystrophy in the abdomen
- Current use of any glucose-lowering agents other than insulin within 3 months prior to screening
- Chronic or recent use of corticosteroids
